Technology*: Ground Source Heat Pump (GSHP) / Geothermal HP
Program Description \n(guideline): 50% of costs, up to $650 for ENERGY STAR Ground Source Heat Pumps with desuperheater
Rebate Value*: Up to $650 per upgrade, capped at 50% of project costs
Equipment Standards Restrictions: 14.1 EER. Must be ENERGY STAR rated.
Contractor Restrictions:
Upgrades must be installed by either an Xcel Energy approved or EnergySmart
contractor to be eligible.
Other Restrictions: Rebates are only available to EnergySmart participants.
Stacking Details: Only one $600 City of Boulder rebate per household

Program Description \n(guideline): 50% of costs, up to $400 for 'Cold Climate' Rated Ducted Air Source Heat Pump (ASHP) (incl. Mini-Splits Cooling & Heating units)
Rebate Value*: Up to $400 per upgrade, capped at 50% of project costs
Equipment Standards Restrictions: HSPF 9/SEER15/1.75 @ 5°F at maximum capacity operation. Must be NEEP.org certified. Must meet ENERGY STAR standards.
Contractor Restrictions:
Upgrades must be installed by either an Xcel Energy approved or EnergySmart
contractor to be eligible.
Other Restrictions:
Rebates are only available to EnergySmart participants.
A thermostatic expansion valve (TXV) is required to help regulate
refrigerant flow to the indoor components with precision and efficiency.
Stacking Details: Only one $400 City of Boulder rebate per household

Program Description \n(guideline): 50% of costs, up to $400 for 'Cold Climate' Rated Ductless Air Source Heat Pump (ASHP) (incl. Mini-Splits Cooling & Heating units)
Rebate Value*: Up to $400 per upgrade, capped at 50% of project costs
Equipment Standards Restrictions: Must be NEEP.org certified. Must meet ENERGY STAR standards.
Contractor Restrictions:
Upgrades must be installed by either an Xcel Energy approved or EnergySmart
contractor to be eligible.
Other Restrictions:
Rebates are only available to EnergySmart participants.
A thermostatic expansion valve (TXV) is required to help regulate
refrigerant flow to the indoor components with precision and efficiency.
Stacking Details: Only one $400 City of Boulder rebate per household

Technology*: Ground Source Heat Pump (GSHP) / Geothermal HP
Program Description \n(guideline): 50% of costs, up to $400 for ENERGY STAR Ground Source Heat Pump (no desuperheater)
Rebate Value*: Up to $400 per upgrade, capped at 50% of project costs
Equipment Standards Restrictions: 14.1 EER. HSPF 10/SEER 15/COP 1.75 @ 5°F at maximum capacity operation. Must be ENERGY STAR rated.
Contractor Restrictions:
Upgrades must be installed by either an Xcel Energy approved or EnergySmart
contractor to be eligible.
Other Restrictions: Rebates are only available to EnergySmart participants.
Stacking Details: Only one $400 City of Boulder rebate per household

Program Description \n(guideline): 50% of costs, up to $250 for 'Non-Cold' Climate Ducted Air Source Heat Pump (ASHP) (incl. Mini-Split Cooling & Heating units) with HSPF 8.5/SEER 15
Rebate Value*: Up to $250 per upgrade, capped at 50% of project costs
Equipment Standards Restrictions: Must meet ENERGY STAR standards. If a suitable heat pump matching these specifications is not available, contact your EnergySmart Advisor.
Contractor Restrictions:
Upgrades must be installed by either an Xcel Energy approved or EnergySmart
contractor to be eligible.
Other Restrictions:
Rebates are only available to EnergySmart participants.
A thermostatic expansion valve (TXV) is required to help regulate
refrigerant flow to the indoor components with precision and efficiency.
Stacking Details: Max 3 $250 City of Boulder rebates per household.

Program Description \n(guideline): 50% of costs, up to $250 for 'Non-Cold' Climate Ductless Air Source Heat Pump (ASHP) with HSPF 8.5/SEER 15
Rebate Value*: Up to $250 per upgrade, capped at 50% of project costs
Contractor Restrictions:
Upgrades must be installed by either an Xcel Energy approved or EnergySmart
contractor to be eligible.
Other Restrictions:
Rebates are only available to EnergySmart participants.
A thermostatic expansion valve (TXV) is required to help regulate
refrigerant flow to the indoor components with precision and efficiency.
Stacking Details: Max 3 $250 City of Boulder rebates per household.

Program Description \n(guideline): 50% of costs, up to $250 for ENERGY STAR Electric Heat Pump Water Heater (minimum 2.00 Energy Factor)
Rebate Value*: Up to $250 per upgrade, capped at 50% of project costs
Equipment Standards Restrictions: Must be rated minimum of 2.00 Energy Factor. See Energy Advisor for list of qualifying equipment. Must meet ENERGY STAR standards.
Contractor Restrictions:
Upgrades must be installed by either an Xcel Energy approved or EnergySmart
contractor to be eligible.
Other Restrictions: Rebates are only available to EnergySmart participants.
Stacking Details: Max 3 $250 City of Boulder rebates per household.

Program Description \n(guideline): 50% of costs, up to $250 for Attic Insulation & Air Sealing
Rebate Value*: Up to $250 per upgrade, capped at 50% of project costs
Equipment Standards Restrictions: R-49 minimum required in open attic; cathedral ceilings will vary with rafter depth. Must meet ENERGY STAR standards.
Contractor Restrictions:
Upgrades must be installed by either an Xcel Energy approved or EnergySmart
contractor to be eligible.
Other Restrictions:
Rebates are only available to EnergySmart participants.
Must perform air sealing in attics prior to adding insulation. Air sealing requirements include the sealing of the void directly above all accessible exterior to plates in attic space.
Stacking Details: Max 3 $250 City of Boulder rebates per household.

Program Description \n(guideline): 50% of costs, up to $250 for Wall Insulation
Rebate Value*: Up to $250 per upgrade, capped at 50% of project costs
Equipment Standards Restrictions: R-19 minimum; fill wall cavity where R-19 not possible. For solid walls such as brick or concrete, exterior rigid insulation must be added to a level of > R-10. Must meet ENERGY STAR standards.
Contractor Restrictions:
Upgrades must be installed by either an Xcel Energy approved or EnergySmart
contractor to be eligible.
Other Restrictions: Rebates are only available to EnergySmart participants.
Stacking Details: Max 3 $250 City of Boulder rebates per household.

Program Description \n(guideline): 50% of costs, up to $250 for Foundation (Crawl Space or Basement) Insulation & Air Sealing
Rebate Value*: Up to $250 per upgrade, capped at 50% of project costs
Equipment Standards Restrictions: Crawlspace as outlined in the 2012 IECC. R-15 continuous or R-19 cavity insulation with a vapor-permeable air barrier over insulation. Crawlspaces must have sealed vapor barrier over dirt crawl space floor and ventilation, per 2012 IECC. Must meet ENERGY STAR standards.
Contractor Restrictions:
Upgrades must be installed by either an Xcel Energy approved or EnergySmart
contractor to be eligible.
Other Restrictions: Rebates are only available to EnergySmart participants.
Stacking Details: Max 3 $250 City of Boulder rebates per household.

Program Description \n(guideline): 50% of costs, up to $250 for Sub-Floor or Frame Floor Insulation & Air Sealing
Rebate Value*: Up to $250 per upgrade, capped at 50% of project costs
Equipment Standards Restrictions: R-30 minimum, over unconditioned space only (i.e., cantilevers, floors over unconditioned crawl, over garage, etc.). Fill enclosed floor cavities when R-30 is not possible. Must meet ENERGY STAR standards.
Contractor Restrictions:
Upgrades must be installed by either an Xcel Energy approved or EnergySmart
contractor to be eligible.
Other Restrictions: Rebates are only available to EnergySmart participants.
Stacking Details: Max 3 $250 City of Boulder rebates per household.

Program Description \n(guideline): 50% of costs, up to $250 for Professionally Applied Air Sealing, and Duct Insulation. Do-it-yourself not eligible.
Rebate Value*: Up to $250 per upgrade, capped at 50% of project costs
Equipment Standards Restrictions: Air infiltration levels must be measured by a blower door before & after improvement. Mechanical ventilation recommended if air changes/hour are below 0.35 NACH. Must meet ENERGY STAR standards.
Contractor Restrictions:
Upgrades must be installed by either an Xcel Energy approved or EnergySmart
contractor to be eligible.
Other Restrictions: Rebates are only available to EnergySmart participants.
Stacking Details: Max 3 $250 City of Boulder rebates per household.

Program Description \n(guideline): 50% of costs, up to $250 for Duct Insulation
Rebate Value*: Up to $250 per upgrade, capped at 50% of project costs
Equipment Standards Restrictions: R-8 minimum, in unconditioned space only. Must meet ENERGY STAR standards.
Contractor Restrictions:
Upgrades must be installed by either an Xcel Energy approved or EnergySmart
contractor to be eligible.
Other Restrictions: Rebates are only available to EnergySmart participants.
Stacking Details: Max 3 $250 City of Boulder rebates per household.

Program Description \n(guideline): Rebate for income-qualified residents or eligible nonprofits for photovoltatic or thermal solar. Capped at lowest of 50% of costs, $1/watt, or $8,000
Rebate Value*: Up to $1/watt, $8,000, or 50% of costs, whichever is lowest
Contractor Restrictions: Must be enrolled in EnergySmart, but does not require use of an EnergySmart contractor to be eligible for rebates
Income Restrictions: Homeowners of individual units must meet income levels laid out in https://bouldercolorado.gov/services/solar-grants.

Program Description \n(guideline): $500/unit up to $1,000 for removing a natural gas furnace or boiler and installing an air or ground source heat pump.
Bonus Description: Additional $500 for installation of solar photovoltaic system (requires removal of natural gas furnace or water heater).
Contractor Restrictions: Must be enrolled in EnergySmart, but does not require use of an EnergySmart contractor to be eligible for rebates. Boiler systems do not require physical removal if there is documentation from installer indicating heat pump installation is appropriately sized to meet the heating needs for the home.
Other Restrictions: Rebates are only available to EnergySmart participants. Bundled fuel switching upgrades may require additional verification to ensure displacement and/or replacement. Please contact an EnergySmart Advisor early to discuss improvements and verification for these rebates. Invoices and pictures are part of the rebate process.
Stacking Details: Can be combined with equipment and insulation upgrades if using an Xcel Energy approved or EnergySmart contractor.

Program Description \n(guideline): $500/unit up to $1,000 for modifying a natural gas furnace with a heat pump add-on.
Bonus Description: Additional $500 for installation of solar photovoltaic system (requires removal of natural gas furnace or water heater).
Contractor Restrictions: Must be enrolled in EnergySmart, but does not require use of an EnergySmart contractor to be eligible for rebates
Other Restrictions: Rebates are only available to EnergySmart participants. Bundled fuel switching upgrades may require additional verification to ensure displacement and/or replacement. Please contact an EnergySmart Advisor early to discuss improvements and verification for these rebates. Invoices and pictures are part of the rebate process.
Stacking Details: Can be combined with equipment and insulation upgrades if using an Xcel Energy approved or EnergySmart contractor.

Program Description \n(guideline): $500/unit up to $1,000 for removing a natural gas water heater and replacing it with an electric water heater
Bonus Description: Additional $500 for installation of solar photovoltaic system (requires removal of natural gas furnace or water heater).
Contractor Restrictions: Must be enrolled in EnergySmart, but does not require use of an EnergySmart contractor to be eligible for rebates
Other Restrictions: Rebates are only available to EnergySmart participants. Bundled fuel switching upgrades may require additional verification to ensure displacement and/or replacement. Please contact an EnergySmart Advisor early to discuss improvements and verification for these rebates. Invoices and pictures are part of the rebate process.
Stacking Details: Can be combined with equipment and insulation upgrades if using an Xcel Energy approved or EnergySmart contractor.

Program Description \n(guideline): $200 rebate for removing a natural gas stove/cooktop and replacing it with an electric cooktop or stove
Contractor Restrictions: Must be enrolled in EnergySmart, but does not require use of an EnergySmart contractor to be eligible for rebates
Other Restrictions: Rebates are only available to EnergySmart participants. Bundled fuel switching upgrades may require additional verification to ensure displacement and/or replacement. Please contact an EnergySmart Advisor early to discuss improvements and verification for these rebates. Invoices and pictures are part of the rebate process.
Stacking Details: Can be combined with equipment and insulation upgrades if using an Xcel Energy approved or EnergySmart contractor.
